column4: ut obituary guestbook services flowers photos back to top obituary. our beloved mother
column10: utah at the age of 87. yoshie was born in bauru
column13: 1928 to hiroaki shigemura and sueka fukunaga
column15: japan. yoshie loved recalling her childhood memories of working hard with her family on a farm in brazil. on february 28th
column17: yoshie married takao sagae in figueira
column19: brazil. they later moved to the city of so paulo where they worked hard to build up a successful laundry business and where they raised a family of three daughters and one son
column20: all of whom immigrated to utah. after her husband passed away
column21: yoshie moved to the united states to be closer to her children and spent her remaining 25 years there with them. she was devoted to her children and grand-children and enjoyed being together with them. yoshie's whole life was one of dedication to the family that she dearly loved and she instilled a deep sense of work
column22: faith and commitment to her children and grandchildren. she loved gardening
column23: sewing and was an excellent cook. yoshie was a strong member of the church of jesus christ of latter-day saints and was a wonderful example of faith to her family yoshie is survived by her children
column33: ut. she is also survived by 12 grandchildren and 10 great-grandchildren. she was preceded in death by her husband
column35: and all but one of her siblings. yoshie will be greatly missed by those who love her and will always able to look to her example of love
column37: hard work and commitment to family and the gospel. we love you
